name: honeycomb
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing honeycomb cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`honeycombio` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing honeycomb cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-honeycomb` repo](https://github.com/thejokersthief/pulumi-honeycomb/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-honeycombio` repo](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-honeycomb` repo](https://github.com/thejokersthief/pulumi-honeycomb/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-honeycombio` repo](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio/issues).

apiKey.description:
The Honeycomb API key to use. It can also be set via the `HONEYCOMB_API_KEY` or `HONEYCOMBIO_APIKEY` environment
variables.

apiKeyId.description:
The ID portion of the Honeycomb Management API key to use. It can also be set via the `HONEYCOMB_KEY_ID` environment
variable.

apiKeySecret.description:
The secret portion of the Honeycomb Management API key to use. It can also be set via the `HONEYCOMB_KEY_SECRET`
environment variable.

apiUrl.description:
Override the URL of the Honeycomb API. Defaults to `https://api.honeycomb.io`. It can also be set via the
`HONEYCOMB_API_ENDPOINT` environment variable.

debug.description: Enable the API client's debug logs. By default, a `TF_LOG` setting of debug or higher will enable this.

createDatasets.description: Allow this key to create missing datasets when sending telemetry. Defaults to `false`.

id.description: The ID of an already existing recipient. Should not be used in combination with `type` and `target`.

notificationDetails.description:
a block of additional details to send along with the notification. The only supported option currently is `pagerduty_severity` which has a default value of `critical` but can be set to one of `info`, `warning`, `error`, or `critical` and must be used in combination with a PagerDuty recipient.

| Type      | Target              |
|-----------|---------------------|
| email     | an email address    |
| pagerduty | _N/A_               |
| slack     | name of the channel |
| webhook   | name of the webhook |

target.description: Target of the recipient, this has another meaning depending on the type of recipient (see the table below). Should not be used in combination with `id`.

type.description: The type of the recipient, allowed types are `email`, `pagerduty`, `msteams`, `slack` and `webhook`. Should not be used in combination with `id`.

pagerdutySeverity.description: The severity to set with the PagerDuty notification. If no severity is provided, 'critical' is assumed.

boards.description: `true` if this API key can create and manage Boards.

columns.description: `true` if this API key can create and manage can create and manage Queries, Columns, Derived Columns, and Query Annotations

datasets.description: `true` if this API key can create and manage Datasets.

events.description: `true` if this API key can key can send events to Honeycomb.

markers.description: `true` if this API key can create and manage Markers.

queries.description: `true` if this API key can execute existing Queries via the Query Data API.

recipients.description: `true` if this API key can create and manage Recipients.

slos.description: `true` if this API key can create and manage SLOs.

triggers.description: `true` if this API key can create and manage Triggers.

classic.description: `true` if this API key belongs to a [Honeycomb Classic](https://docs.honeycomb.io/honeycomb-classic/) environment.

name.description: The name of the detail field to filter by. Currently only `name` is supported.

value.description: The value of the detail field to match on.

valueRegex.description:
A regular expression string to apply to the value of the detail field to match on.

> **Note** one of `value` or `value_regex` is required.

name.description: The name of the detail field to filter by. Currently only `name` is supported.

value.description: The value of the detail field to match on.

valueRegex.description:
A regular expression string to apply to the value of the detail field to match on.

> **Note** one of `value` or `value_regex` is required.

column.description: The column to apply the operator to, not needed with `COUNT` or `CONCURRENCY`.

op.description: The operator to apply, see the supported list of calculation operators at [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators).

column.description: The column to apply the filter to.

op.description: The operator to apply, see the supported list of filter operators at [Filter Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#filter-operators). Not all operators require a value.

value.description:
The value used for the filter. Not needed if op is `exists` or `not-exists`. Mutually exclusive with the other `value_*` options.

* > **NOTE** Filter op `in` and `not-in` expect an array of strings as value. Use the `value` attribute and pass the values in single string separated by `,` without additional spaces (similar to the query builder in the UI). For example: the list `foo`, `bar` becomes `foo,bar`.

calculateOp.description: The calculation operator to apply, supports all of the [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators) with the exception of `HEATMAP`.

column.description: The column to apply the `calculate_op` to, not needed with `COUNT` or `CONCURRENCY`.

op.description: The operator to apply to filter the query results. One of `=`, `!=`, `>`, `>=`, `<`, or `<=`.

value.description:
The value used with `op`. Currently assumed to be a number.

> **NOTE** A having term's `column`/`calculate_op` pair must have a corresponding `calculation`. There can be multiple `having` blocks for the same `column`/`calculate_op` pair.

column.description: Either a column present in `breakdown` or a column that `op` applies to.

op.description: The calculation operator to apply, see the supported list of calculation operators at [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators).

order.description: The sort direction, if set must be `ascending` or `descending`.

name.description: The name of the detail field to filter by. Currently only `name` is supported.

value.description: The value of the detail field to match on.

valueRegex.description:
A regular expression string to apply to the value of the detail field to match on.

> **Note** one of `value` or `value_regex` is required.

daysOfWeeks.description: A list of days of the week (in lowercase) to evaluate the trigger on

endTime.description: UTC time to stop evaluating the trigger in HH:mm format (e.g. `13:00`)

startTime.description: UTC time to start evaluating the trigger in HH:mm format (e.g. `13:00`)

id.description: The ID of an already existing recipient. Cannot not be used in combination with `type` and `target`.

notificationDetails.description:
a block of additional details to send along with the notification. The only supported option currently is `pagerduty_severity` which has a default value of `critical` but can be set to one of `info`, `warning`, `error`, or `critical` and must be used in combination with a PagerDuty recipient.

Type      | Target
----------|-------------------------
email     | an email address
marker    | name of the marker
pagerduty | _N/A_
slack     | name of the channel
webhook   | name of the webhook

target.description:
Target of the trigger recipient, this has another meaning depending on the type of recipient (see the table below).
Cannot not be used in combination with `id`.

type.description:
The type of the trigger recipient, allowed types are `email`, `marker`, `msteams`, `pagerduty`, `slack` and `webhook`.
Cannot not be used in combination with `id`.

pagerdutySeverity.description: The severity to set with the PagerDuty notification. If no severity is provided, 'critical' is assumed.

exceededLimit.description: The number of times the threshold is met before an alert is sent, must be between 1 and 5. Defaults to `1`.

op.description: The operator to apply, allowed threshold operators are `>`, `>=`, `<`, and `<=`.

value.description: The value to be used with the operator.

provider.description:
The provider type for the honeycombio package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

debug.description: Enable the API client's debug logs. By default, a `TF_LOG` setting of debug or higher will enable this.

alertType.description:
Type of the burn alert. Valid values are `exhaustion_time` and `budget_rate`. 
Defaults to `exhaustion_time`.

budgetRateDecreasePercent.description:
The percent the budget has decreased over the budget rate window.
The alert will fire when this budget decrease threshold is reached.
Must be between 0.0001% and 100%, with no more than 4 numbers past the decimal point.
Required when `alert_type` is `budget_rate`.
Must not be provided when `alert_type` is `exhaustion_time`.

budgetRateWindowMinutes.description:
The time period, in minutes, over which a budget rate will be calculated. 
Must be between 60 and the associated SLO's time period.
Required when `alert_type` is `budget_rate`.
Must not be provided when `alert_type` is `exhaustion_time`.

dataset.description: The dataset this burn alert is associated with.

exhaustionMinutes.description:
The amount of time, in minutes, remaining before the SLO's error budget will be exhausted and 
the alert will fire.
Must be 0 or greater.
Required when `alert_type` is `exhaustion_time`.
Must not be provided when `alert_type` is `budget_rate`.

recipients.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the alert fires.

sloId.description: ID of the SLO this burn alert is associated with.

alertType.description:
Type of the burn alert. Valid values are `exhaustion_time` and `budget_rate`. 
Defaults to `exhaustion_time`.

budgetRateDecreasePercent.description:
The percent the budget has decreased over the budget rate window.
The alert will fire when this budget decrease threshold is reached.
Must be between 0.0001% and 100%, with no more than 4 numbers past the decimal point.
Required when `alert_type` is `budget_rate`.
Must not be provided when `alert_type` is `exhaustion_time`.

budgetRateWindowMinutes.description:
The time period, in minutes, over which a budget rate will be calculated. 
Must be between 60 and the associated SLO's time period.
Required when `alert_type` is `budget_rate`.
Must not be provided when `alert_type` is `exhaustion_time`.

dataset.description: The dataset this burn alert is associated with.

exhaustionMinutes.description:

the alert will fire.
Must be 0 or greater.
Required when `alert_type` is `exhaustion_time`.
Must not be provided when `alert_type` is `budget_rate`.

recipients.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the alert fires.

sloId.description: ID of the SLO this burn alert is associated with.

Type of the burn alert. Valid values are `exhaustion_time` and `budget_rate`.

The alert will fire when this budget decrease threshold is reached.
Must be between 0.0001% and 100%, with no more than 4 numbers past the decimal point.
Required when `alert_type` is `budget_rate`.
Must not be provided when `alert_type` is `exhaustion_time`.

recipients.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the alert fires.

sloId.description: ID of the SLO this burn alert is associated with.

createdAt.description: ISO8601-formatted time the dataset was created

deleteProtected.description: the current state of the Dataset's deletion protection status. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false on create.

expandJsonDepth.description: The maximum unpacking depth of nested JSON fields.

lastWrittenAt.description: ISO8601-formatted time the dataset was last written to (received event data)

color.description:
The color to display the Environment in the navigation bar.
If not provided one will be randomly selected at creation.
One of `blue`, `green`, `gold`, `red`, `purple`, `lightBlue`, `lightGreen`, `lightGold`, `lightRed`, `lightPurple`.

deleteProtected.description:
the current state of the Environment's deletion protection status.
Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to `false` on create.

name.description: The name of the Environment. Must be unique to the Team.

The color to display the Environment in the navigation bar.
If not provided one will be randomly selected at creation.
One of `blue`, `green`, `gold`, `red`, `purple`, `lightBlue`, `lightGreen`, `lightGold`, `lightRed`, `lightPurple`.

the current state of the Environment's deletion protection status.
Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to `false` on create.

deleteProtected.description:
the current state of the Environment's deletion protection status.
Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to `false` on create.

name.description: The name of the Environment. Must be unique to the Team.

honeycomb:index/query:Query.description:
## # Resource: honeycomb.Query

Creates a Query scoped to a Dataset or Environment.

Queries can be used by Triggers and Boards, or be executed via the [Query Data API](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-results/).

> **Note** Queries are immutable and can not be deleted -- only created or read.
  Any changes will result in a new query object being created.

## Import

Querys can be imported using a combination of the dataset name and their ID, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import honeycomb:index/query:Query my_query my-dataset/bj8BwOa1uRz
```

dataset.description:
The dataset this query is scoped to.
Use `__all__` for Environment-wide queries.

queryJson.description:
A JSON object describing the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification).
While the JSON can be constructed manually, using the `honeycomb.GetQuerySpecification` data source provides deeper validation.

dataset.description:
The dataset this query is scoped to.
Use `__all__` for Environment-wide queries.

queryJson.description:
A JSON object describing the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification).
While the JSON can be constructed manually, using the `honeycomb.GetQuerySpecification` data source provides deeper validation.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Query resources.

dataset.description:
The dataset this query is scoped to.
Use `__all__` for Environment-wide queries.

queryJson.description:
A JSON object describing the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification).
While the JSON can be constructed manually, using the `honeycomb.GetQuerySpecification` data source provides deeper validation.

alertType.description: The frequency for the alert to trigger. (`on_change` is the default behavior, `on_true` can also be selected)

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

evaluationSchedule.description:
A configuration block (described below) that determines when the trigger is run.
When the time is within the scheduled window the trigger will be run at the specified frequency.
Outside of the window, the trigger will not be run.
If no schedule is specified, the trigger will be run at the specified frequency at all times.

frequency.description:
The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the querys calculation against the threshold.
This value must be divisible by 60, between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day), and not be more than 4 times the query's duration (see note below).
Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute. Conflicts with `query_json`.

queryJson.description:
The Query Specfication JSON for the Trigger to execute.
Providing the Query Specification as JSON -- as opposed to a Query ID -- enables additional validation during the validate and plan stages.
Conflicts with `query_id`.

recipients.description:
Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

One of `query_id` or `query_json` are required.

> **NOTE** The query used in a Trigger must follow a strict subset: the query must contain *exactly one* calcuation and may only contain `calculation`, `filter`, `filter_combination` and `breakdowns` fields.
The query's duration cannot be more than four times the trigger frequency (i.e. `duration <= frequency*4`).
See [A Caveat on Time](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/query-specification/#a-caveat-on-time)) for more information on specifying a query's duration.
For example: if using the default query `time_range` of `7200` the lowest `frequency` for a trigger is `1800`.

threshold.description: A configuration block (described below) describing the threshold of the trigger.

alertType.description: The frequency for the alert to trigger. (`on_change` is the default behavior, `on_true` can also be selected)

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

evaluationSchedule.description:
A configuration block (described below) that determines when the trigger is run.
When the time is within the scheduled window the trigger will be run at the specified frequency.
Outside of the window, the trigger will not be run.
If no schedule is specified, the trigger will be run at the specified frequency at all times.

frequency.description:
The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the querys calculation against the threshold.
This value must be divisible by 60, between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day), and not be more than 4 times the query's duration (see note below).
Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute. Conflicts with `query_json`.

queryJson.description:
The Query Specfication JSON for the Trigger to execute.
Providing the Query Specification as JSON -- as opposed to a Query ID -- enables additional validation during the validate and plan stages.
Conflicts with `query_id`.

recipients.description:
Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

One of `query_id` or `query_json` are required.

> **NOTE** The query used in a Trigger must follow a strict subset: the query must contain *exactly one* calcuation and may only contain `calculation`, `filter`, `filter_combination` and `breakdowns` fields.
The query's duration cannot be more than four times the trigger frequency (i.e. `duration <= frequency*4`).
See [A Caveat on Time](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/query-specification/#a-caveat-on-time)) for more information on specifying a query's duration.
For example: if using the default query `time_range` of `7200` the lowest `frequency` for a trigger is `1800`.

threshold.description: A configuration block (described below) describing the threshold of the trigger.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Trigger resources.

alertType.description: The frequency for the alert to trigger. (`on_change` is the default behavior, `on_true` can also be selected)

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

evaluationSchedule.description:
A configuration block (described below) that determines when the trigger is run.
When the time is within the scheduled window the trigger will be run at the specified frequency.
Outside of the window, the trigger will not be run.
If no schedule is specified, the trigger will be run at the specified frequency at all times.

The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the querys calculation against the threshold.
This value must be divisible by 60, between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day), and not be more than 4 times the query's duration (see note below).
Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute. Conflicts with `query_json`.

queryJson.description:
The Query Specfication JSON for the Trigger to execute.
Providing the Query Specification as JSON -- as opposed to a Query ID -- enables additional validation during the validate and plan stages.
Conflicts with `query_id`.

recipients.description:
Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

One of `query_id` or `query_json` are required.

> **NOTE** The query used in a Trigger must follow a strict subset: the query must contain *exactly one* calcuation and may only contain `calculation`, `filter`, `filter_combination` and `breakdowns` fields.
The query's duration cannot be more than four times the trigger frequency (i.e. `duration <= frequency*4`).
See [A Caveat on Time](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/query-specification/#a-caveat-on-time)) for more information on specifying a query's duration.
For example: if using the default query `time_range` of `7200` the lowest `frequency` for a trigger is `1800`.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetAuthMetadata.

apiKeyAccess.description:
The authorizations granted for the API key used to authenticate the provider.
See [the documentation](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/settings/api-keys/) for more information.

environment.description: Information about the Environment the API key is scoped to.

team.description: Information about the Team the API key is scoped to.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetAuthMetadata.

apiKeyAccess.description:
The authorizations granted for the API key used to authenticate the provider.
See [the documentation](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/settings/api-keys/) for more information.

environment.description: Information about the Environment the API key is scoped to.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

team.description: Information about the Team the API key is scoped to.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetDataset.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetDataset.

createdAt.description: ISO8601-formatted time the dataset was created.

deleteProtected.description: the current state of the Dataset's deletion protection status.

expandJsonDepth.description: The Dataset's maximum unpacking depth of nested JSON fields.

lastWrittenAt.description: ISO8601-formatted time the dataset was last written to (received event data).

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetDatasets.

detailFilter.description: a block to further filter results as described below. `name` must be set when providing a filter. Conflicts with `starts_with`.

startsWith.description: Deprecated: use `detail_filter` instead. Only return datasets whose name starts with the given value.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetDatasets.

names.description: a list of all the dataset names.

slugs.description: a list of all the dataset slugs.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetDerivedColumn.

dataset.description: The dataset this derived column is associated with. Use `__all__` for Environment-wide derived columns.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetDerivedColumn.

description.description: the description of the derived column

expression.description: the expression of the derived column

id.description: the ID of the derived column.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetDerivedColumns.

dataset.description: The dataset to retrieve the columns list from. Use `__all__` for Environment-wide derived columns.

startsWith.description: Only return derived columns starting with the given value.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetDerivedColumns.

names.description: a list of all the derived column names found in the dataset

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetEnvironment.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetEnvironment.

deleteProtected.description: the current state of the Environment's deletion protection status.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetEnvironments.

detailFilter.description: a block to further filter results as described below. `name` must be set when providing a filter.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetEnvironments.

ids.description: a list of all the Environment IDs found in the Team.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetQuerySpecification.

breakdowns.description: A list of fields to group by.

calculations.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the calculations that should be displayed. If no calculations are specified, `COUNT` will be used.

endTime.description: The absolute end time of the query in Unix Time (= seconds since epoch).

filterCombination.description: How to combine multiple filters, either `AND` (default) or `OR`.

filters.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the filters that should be applied.

granularity.description:
The time resolution of the querys graph, in seconds. Valid values must be in between the querys time range /10 at maximum, and /1000 at minimum.

> **NOTE** It is not allowed to specify all three of `time_range`, `start_time` and `end_time`. For more details about specifying time windows, check [Query specification: A caveat on time](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#a-caveat-on-time).

havings.description: Zero or more filters used to restrict returned groups in the query result.

limit.description: The maximum number of query results, must be between 1 and 1000.

orders.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) describing how to order the query results. Each term must appear in either `calculation` or `breakdowns`.

startTime.description: The absolute start time of the query in Unix Time (= seconds since epoch).

timeRange.description: The time range of the query in seconds, defaults to `7200` (two hours).

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetQuerySpecification.

id.deprecationMessage: The `id` attribute is deprecated and included for compatibility with the Terraform Plugin SDK. It will be removed in a future version.

json.description: JSON representation of the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification), can be used as input for other resources.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetSLO.

dataset.description: The dataset this SLO is associated with

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetSLO.

sli.description: the alias of the Derived Column used as the SLO's SLI.

targetPercentage.description: the percentage of qualified events expected to succeed during the `time_period`.

timePeriod.description: The time period, in days, over which the SLO is evaluated.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetSLOs.

dataset.description: The dataset to retrieve the SLOs list from

detailFilter.description: a block to further filter results as described below. `name` must be set when providing a filter.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetSLOs.

ids.description: a list of all the SLO IDs found in the dataset
